title: [backlog] Cache Of Color inside of instance can cause color problems when changing labels colors
body:
In some cases we can be tempted to use instance.label_file.colour to get the color of the instance.

We need to make sure this is a fallback only mechanism and we always default to use the project colour map (or task color map for task mode)

Idea from discussions:

Add to the instance object (In Frontend) a  function like
`get_colour()` 
that popualates the color from the project map and if not avaialble it goes to the cache 
in other words since it's so desirable to have that label_file as a key, but we can't, use a similar name but as a function.


So basiacally this issue would be a small refactor to:
1. Make sure we are getting the colors of the instance in a centralized matter, currently instance_list component has many parts that deal with the color. We should place them all in a single place.
2. Make sure we are getting the project color map in the project context, and the color map from the task/job in the task context. We should almost never use the label_file.colour as this is just a fallback mechanism.

Some commits that worked in that direction: https://github.com/diffgram/diffgram/pull/271/commits/4277ae1b90ad188ce1ea79195f402b5c4fdc4633
